   20: %%% Purpose : Test interaction Erlang/Drivers (new features as of R3A)
   21: 
   22: %%% Checks that new features (as of R3) of the Erlang/Driver
   23: %%% implementation works as expected.
   24: %%%
   25: %%% Things that should be tested:
   26: %%% - outputv
   27: %%% - timeouts
   28: %%% - queueing
   29: 
   30: -module(driver_SUITE).
   31: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, 
   32:          end_per_suite/1, init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   33:          init_per_testcase/2,
   34:          end_per_testcase/2,
   35: 
   36:          a_test/1,
   37:          outputv_echo/1,
   38:          timer_measure/1,
   39:          timer_cancel/1,
   40:          timer_change/1,
   41:          timer_delay/1,
   42:          queue_echo/1,

   45:          io_ready_exit/1,
   46:          use_fallback_pollset/0,
   47:          use_fallback_pollset/1,
   48:          bad_fd_in_pollset/1,
   49:          fd_change/1,
   50:          steal_control/1,
   51:          otp_6602/1,
   52:          driver_system_info_base_ver/1,
   53:          driver_system_info_prev_ver/1,
   54:          driver_system_info_current_ver/1,
   55:          driver_monitor/1,
   56: 
   57:          ioq_exit_ready_input/1,
   58:          ioq_exit_ready_output/1,
   59:          ioq_exit_timeout/1,
   60:          ioq_exit_ready_async/1,
   61:          ioq_exit_ready_input_async/1,
   62:          ioq_exit_ready_output_async/1,
   63:          ioq_exit_timeout_async/1,
   64:          zero_extended_marker_garb_drv/1,
   65:          invalid_extended_marker_drv/1,
   66:          larger_major_vsn_drv/1,
   67:          larger_minor_vsn_drv/1,
   68:          smaller_major_vsn_drv/1,
   69:          smaller_minor_vsn_drv/1,
   70:          peek_non_existing_queue/1,
   71:          otp_6879/1,
   72:          caller/1,
   73:          many_events/1,
   74:          missing_callbacks/1,
   75:          smp_select/1,
   76:          driver_select_use/1,

   78:          otp_9302/1,
   79:          thr_free_drv/1,
   80:          async_blast/1,
   81:          thr_msg_blast/0,
   82:          thr_msg_blast/1,
   83:          consume_timeslice/1,
   84:          env/1,
   85:          poll_pipe/1,
   86:          lots_of_used_fds_on_boot/1,
   87:          z_test/1]).
   88: 
   89: -export([bin_prefix/2]).
   90: 
   91: -export([get_check_io_total/1]).   % for z_SUITE.erl
   92: -export([check_io_debug/0]). %% For nif_SUITE.erl
   93: 
   94: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   95: 
   96: 
   97: % First byte in communication with the timer driver
   98: -define(START_TIMER, 0).
   99: -define(CANCEL_TIMER, 1).
  100: -define(DELAY_START_TIMER, 2).
  101: -define(TIMER, 3).
  102: -define(CANCELLED, 4).
  103: 
  104: % First byte in communication with queue driver
  105: -define(PUSHQ, 0).
  106: -define(ENQ, 1).
  107: -define(PUSHQ_BIN, 2).
  108: -define(ENQ_BIN, 3).
  109: -define(PUSHQV, 4).
  110: -define(ENQV, 5).
  111: 
  112: -define(DEQ, 6).
  113: -define(BYTES_QUEUED, 7).
  114: -define(READ_HEAD, 8).
  115: 
  116: -define(RANDOM, random).
  117: 
  118: % Max data size that is queued in one instance
  119: -define(MAX_DATA_SIZE, 16384).
  120: 
  121: % This is the allowed delay when testing the driver timer functionality
  122: -define(delay, 400).
  123: 
  124: -define(heap_binary_size, 64).
  125: 
  126: suite() ->
  127:     [{ct_hooks,[cth_log_redirect,ts_install_cth]},
  128:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
  129: 
  130: all() -> %% Keep a_test first and z_test last...
  131:     [a_test, outputv_errors, outputv_echo, queue_echo,
  132:      {group, timer},
  133:      driver_unloaded, io_ready_exit, otp_6602,
  134:      {group, polling},
  135:      {group, poll_thread},
  136:      {group, poll_set},
  137:      driver_system_info_base_ver,
  138:      driver_system_info_prev_ver,
  139:      driver_system_info_current_ver, driver_monitor,
  140:      {group, ioq_exit}, zero_extended_marker_garb_drv,
  141:      invalid_extended_marker_drv, larger_major_vsn_drv,
  142:      larger_minor_vsn_drv, smaller_major_vsn_drv,
  143:      smaller_minor_vsn_drv, peek_non_existing_queue,
  144:      otp_6879, caller, many_events, missing_callbacks,
  145:      thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean,
  146:      otp_9302,
  147:      thr_free_drv,
  148:      async_blast,
  149:      thr_msg_blast,
  150:      consume_timeslice,
  151:      env,
  152:      poll_pipe,
  153:      z_test].
  154: 
  155: groups() -> 
  156:     [{timer, [],
  157:       [timer_measure, timer_cancel, timer_delay,
  158:        timer_change]},
  159:      {poll_thread, [], [{group, polling}]},
  160:      {poll_set, [], [{group, polling}]},
  161:      {polling, [],
  162:       [a_test, use_fallback_pollset,
  163:        bad_fd_in_pollset, fd_change,
  164:        steal_control, smp_select,
  165:        driver_select_use,
  166:        lots_of_used_fds_on_boot,
  167:        z_test]},
  168:      {ioq_exit, [],
  169:       [ioq_exit_ready_input, ioq_exit_ready_output,
  170:        ioq_exit_timeout, ioq_exit_ready_async,
  171:        ioq_exit_ready_input_async, ioq_exit_ready_output_async,
  172:        ioq_exit_timeout_async]}].
  173: 
  174: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  175:     logger:add_handler_filter(default,
  176:       checkio_filter,
  177:       {fun F(#{ msg := {string,Str}} = Log, _State) ->
  178:                case re:run(Str,"(fds in pollset)|(Bad value on output port)") of
  179:                    {match,_} ->
  180:                        stop;
  181:                    _ ->
  182:                        Log
  183:                end;
  184:            F(#{ msg := {Fmt,Args}} = Log, State) when not is_atom(Fmt) ->
  185:                F(Log#{ msg := {string,io_lib:format(Fmt,Args)}}, State);
  186:            F(Log, _State) ->
  187:                Log
  188:        end, undefined}),
  189:     Config.
  190: 
  191: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  192:     logger:remove_handler_filter(default, checkio_filter),
  193:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  194: 
  195:     case nodes(connected) of
  196:         [] -> ok;
  197:         Nodes ->
  198:             [net_kernel:disconnect(N) || N <- Nodes],
  199:             io:format("LEAKED connections: ~p\n", [Nodes])
  200:     end.
  201: 
  202: 
  203: init_per_group(poll_thread, Config) ->
  204:     [{node_args, ["+IOt", "2"]} | Config];
  205: init_per_group(poll_set, Config) ->
  206:     [{node_args, ["+IOt", "2", "+IOp", "2"]} | Config];
  207: init_per_group(polling, Config) ->
  208:     case proplists:get_value(node_args, Config) of
  209:         undefined ->
  210:             Config;
  211:         Args ->
  212:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  213:             unlink(Peer), %% otherwise it will immediately stop
  214:             setup_logger(Node),
  215:             [{node, {Peer, Node}} | Config]
  216:     end;
  217: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  218:     Config.
  219: 
  220: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  221:     case proplists:get_value(node, Config) of
  222:         undefined ->
  223:             Config;
  224:         {Peer, _Node} ->
  225:             ok = peer:stop(Peer),
  226:             {save_config, proplists:delete(node, Config)}
  227:     end.
  228: 
  229: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
  230:     CIOD = rpc(Config,
  231:                fun() ->
  232:                        case catch erts_debug:get_internal_state(available_internal_state) of
  233:                            true -> ok;
  234:                            _ -> erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true)
  235:                        end,
  236:                        erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)
  237:                end),
  238:     0 = element(1, CIOD),
  239:     [{testcase, Case}|Config].
  240: 
  241: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  242:     %% Logs some info about the system
  243:     ct_os_cmd("epmd -names"),
  244:     ct_os_cmd("ps aux"),
  245:     try rpc(Config, fun() ->
  246:                             get_stable_check_io_info(),
  247:                             erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)
  248:                     end) of
  249:         CIOD ->
  250:             0 = element(1, CIOD)
  251:     catch _E:_R:_ST ->
  252:             %% Restart the node
  253:             case proplists:get_value(node, Config) of
  254:                 undefined ->
  255:                     ok;
  256:                 {Peer, _Node} ->
  257:                     peer:stop(Peer),
  258:                     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(proplists:get_value(node_args, Config)),
  259:                     unlink(Peer2), %% otherwise it will immediately stop
  260:                     setup_logger(Node2),
  261:                     Config2 = [{node, {Peer2, Node2}} | proplists:delete(node, Config)],
  262:                     {save_config, Config2}
  263:             end
  264:     end,
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: ct_os_cmd(Cmd) ->
  268:     ct:log("~s: ~ts",[Cmd,os:cmd(Cmd)]).
  269: 
  270: %% Test sending bad types to port with an outputv-capable driver.
  271: outputv_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  272:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  273:     erl_ddll:start(),
  274:     ok = load_driver(Path, outputv_drv),
  275: 
  276:     outputv_bad_types(fun(T) ->
  277:                               outputv_errors_1(T),
  278:                               outputv_errors_1([1|T]),
  279:                               L = [1,2,3],
  280:                               outputv_errors_1([L,T]),
  281:                               outputv_errors_1([L|T])
  282:                       end),
  283:     outputv_errors_1(42),
  284: 
  285:     %% Test iolists that do not fit in the address space.
  286:     %% Unfortunately, it would be too slow to test in a 64-bit emulator.
  287:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  288:         4 -> outputv_huge_iolists();
  289:         _ -> ok
  290:     end.
  291: 
  292: outputv_bad_types(Test) ->
  293:     Types = [-1,256,atom,42.0,{a,b,c},make_ref(),fun() -> 42 end,
  294:              [1|2],<<1:1>>,<<1:9>>,<<1:15>>],
  295:     _ = [Test(Type) || Type <- Types],
  296:     ok.
  297: 
  298: outputv_huge_iolists() ->
  299:     FourGigs = 1 bsl 32,
  300:     Sizes = [FourGigs+N || N <- lists:seq(0, 64)] ++
  301:     [1 bsl N || N <- lists:seq(33, 37)],
  302:     Base = <<0:(1 bsl 20)/unit:8>>,
  303:     [begin
  304:          L = build_iolist(Sz, Base),
  305:          outputv_errors_1(L)
  306:      end || Sz <- Sizes],
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: outputv_errors_1(Term) ->
  310:     Port = open_port({spawn_driver,outputv_drv}, []),
  311:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch port_command(Port, Term)),
  312:     port_close(Port).
  313: 
  314: build_iolist(N, Base) when N < 16 ->
  315:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  316:         1 ->
  317:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  318:             Bin;
  319:         _ ->
  320:             lists:seq(1, N)
  321:     end;
  322: build_iolist(N, Base) when N =< byte_size(Base) ->
  323:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  324:         1 ->
  325:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  326:             Bin;
  327:         2 ->
  328:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  329:             [Bin];
  330:         3 ->
  331:             case N rem 2 of
  332:                 0 ->
  333:                     L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  334:                     [L,L];
  335:                 1 ->
  336:                     L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  337:                     [L,L,45]
  338:             end
  339:     end;
  340: build_iolist(N0, Base) ->
  341:     Small = rand:uniform(15),
  342:     Seq = lists:seq(1, Small),
  343:     N = N0 - Small,
  344:     case N rem 2 of
  345:         0 ->
  346:             L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  347:             [L,L|Seq];
  348:         1 ->
  349:             L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  350:             [47,L,L|Seq]
  351:     end.
  352: 
  353: %% Test echoing data with a driver that supports outputv.
  354: outputv_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  356:     Name = 'outputv_drv',
  357:     P = start_driver(Config, Name, true),
  358: 
  359:     ov_test(P, {bin,0}),
  360:     ov_test(P, {bin,1}),
  361:     ov_test(P, {bin,2}),
  362:     ov_test(P, {bin,3}),
  363:     ov_test(P, {bin,4}),
  364:     ov_test(P, {bin,5}),
  365:     ov_test(P, {bin,6}),
  366:     ov_test(P, {bin,7}),
  367:     ov_test(P, {bin,8}),
  368:     ov_test(P, {bin,15}),
  369:     ov_test(P, {bin,16}),
  370:     ov_test(P, {bin,17}),
  371: 
  372:     ov_test(P, {list,0}),
  373:     ov_test(P, {list,1}),
  374:     ov_test(P, {list,2}),
  375:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,0},int]),
  376:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,1},int]),
  377:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,2}]),
  378:     ov_test(P, [{list,3},int,int,{list,2}]),
  379:     ov_test(P, {list,33}),
  380: 
  381:     ov_test(P, [{bin,0}]),
  382:     ov_test(P, [{bin,1}]),
  383:     ov_test(P, [{bin,2}]),
  384:     ov_test(P, [{bin,3}]),
  385:     ov_test(P, [{bin,4}]),
  386:     ov_test(P, [{bin,5}]),
  387:     ov_test(P, [{bin,6},int]),
  388:     ov_test(P, [int,{bin,3}]),
  389:     ov_test(P, [int|{bin,4}]),
  390:     ov_test(P, [{bin,17},int,{bin,13}|{bin,3}]),
  391: 
  392:     ov_test(P, [int,{bin,17},int,{bin,?heap_binary_size+1}|{bin,3}]),
  393: 
  394:     stop_driver(P, Name),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: ov_test(Port, Template) ->
  398:     Self = self(),
  399:     spawn_opt(erlang, apply, [fun () -> ov_test(Self, Port, Template) end,[]],
  400:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  401:     receive
  402:         done -> ok
  403:     end.
  404: 
  405: ov_test(Parent, Port, Template) ->
  406:     true = port_connect(Port, self()),
  407: 
  408:     HeapData = build_data(Template),
  409:     io:format("Mostly heap binaries"),
  410:     ov_send_and_test(Port, HeapData, HeapData),
  411: 
  412:     %% Try sub binaries.
  413:     io:format("Mostly sub binaries of heap binaries"),
  414:     SubHeapData = make_sub_binaries(HeapData),
  415:     ov_send_and_test(Port, SubHeapData, HeapData),
  416: 
  417:     %% Try refc binaries.
  418:     io:format("Refc binaries"),
  419:     RefcData = make_refc_binaries(HeapData),
  420:     ov_send_and_test(Port, RefcData, RefcData),
  421: 
  422:     %% Try sub binaries of heap binaries.
  423:     io:format("Sub binaries of refc binaries"),
  424:     SubRefcData = make_sub_binaries(RefcData),
  425:     ov_send_and_test(Port, SubRefcData, RefcData),
  426:     io:format("", []),
  427: 
  428:     %% Garbage collect and make sure that there are no binaries left.
  429:     %% R7 note:
  430:     %%  - dead variables on the stack are killed after last use,
  431:     %%  - erlang:garbage_collect/0 collects garbage immediately.
  432:     %%  (there used to be dummy functions here)
  433:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  434:     {binary,[]} = process_info(self(), binary),
  435: 
  436:     %% Reassign Port back to parent and tell him we are done.
  437:     true = port_connect(Port, Parent),
  438:     Parent ! done.
  439: 
  440: ov_send_and_test(Port, Data, ExpectedResult) ->
  441:     io:format("~p ! ~P", [Port,Data,12]),
  442:     Port ! {self(),{command,Data}},
  443:     receive 
  444:         {Port,{data,ReturnData}} ->
  445:             io:format("~p returned ~P", [Port,ReturnData,12]),
  446:             compare(ReturnData, ExpectedResult);
  447:         {Port,{data,OtherData}} ->
  448:             ct:fail("~p returned WRONG data ~p", [Port,OtherData]);
  449:         Wrong ->
  450:             ct:fail({unexpected_port_or_data,Wrong})
  451:     end.
  452: 
  453: compare(Got, Expected) ->
  454:     case {list_to_binary([Got]),list_to_binary([Expected])} of
  455:         {B,B} -> ok;
  456:         {_Gb,_Eb} ->
  457:             ct:fail(got_bad_data)
  458:     end.
  459: 
  460: 
  461: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  462: %% 		Driver timer test suites
  463: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  464: 
  465: 
  466: %% Check that timers time out in good time.
  467: timer_measure(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  468:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  469:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  470: 
  471:     try_timeouts(Port, 8997),
  472: 
  473:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  474:     ok.
  475: 
  476: try_timeouts(_, 0) -> ok;
  477: try_timeouts(Port, Timeout) ->
  478:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  479:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout:32>>),
  480:     receive
  481:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  482:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  483:             io:format("Elapsed: ~p Timeout: ~p\n", [Elapsed, Timeout]),
  484:             if
  485:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  486:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  487:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  488:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  489:                 true ->
  490:                     try_timeouts(Port, Timeout div 2)
  491:             end
  492:     after Timeout + 100*?delay ->
  493:               ct:fail("driver failed to timeout")
  494:     end.
  495: 
  496: %% Try cancelling timers set in a driver.
  497: timer_cancel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  498:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  499:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  500: 
  501:     try_cancel(Port, 10000),
  502: 
  503:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: try_cancel(Port, Timeout) ->
  507:     T_before = erl_millisecs(),
  508:     Port ! {self(),{command,<<?START_TIMER,(Timeout + ?delay):32>>}},
  509:     receive
  510:         {Port, {data, [?TIMER]}} ->
  511:             ct:fail("driver timed out before cancelling it")
  512:     after Timeout -> 
  513:               Port ! {self(), {command, [?CANCEL_TIMER]}},
  514:               receive 
  515:                   {Port, {data, [?TIMER]}} ->
  516:                       ct:fail("driver timed out after cancelling it");
  517:                   {Port, {data, [?CANCELLED]}} ->
  518:                       Time_milli_secs = erl_millisecs() - T_before,
  519: 
  520:                       io:format("Time_milli_secs: ~p Timeout: ~p\n",
  521:                                 [Time_milli_secs, Timeout]), 
  522:                       if
  523:                           Time_milli_secs > (Timeout + ?delay) ->
  524:                               ct:fail("too long real time");
  525:                           Timeout == 0 -> ok;
  526:                           true -> try_cancel(Port, Timeout div 2)
  527:                       end
  528:               after 100*?delay ->
  529:                         ct:fail("No message from driver")
  530:               end
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: %% Test that timers don't time out too early if we do a sleep
  534: %% before setting a timer.
  535: 
  536: timer_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  537:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  538:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  539: 
  540:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  541:     Timeout0 = 350,
  542:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?DELAY_START_TIMER,Timeout0:32>>),
  543:     Timeout = Timeout0 + 1000,
  544:     receive
  545:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  546:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  547:             io:format("Elapsed time: ~p Timeout: ~p\n",
  548:                       [Elapsed,Timeout]), 
  549:             if
  550:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  551:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  552:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  553:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  554:                 true ->
  555:                     ok
  556:             end
  557:     end,
  558: 
  559:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  560:     ok.
  561: 
  562: %% Test that driver_set_timer with new timeout really changes
  563: %% the timer (ticket OTP-5942), it didn't work before
  564: 
  565: timer_change(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  567:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  568: 
  569:     try_change_timer(Port, 10000),
  570: 
  571:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  572:     ok.
  573: 
  574: try_change_timer(_Port, 0) -> ok;
  575: try_change_timer(Port, Timeout) ->
  576:     Timeout_3 = Timeout*3,
  577:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  578:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout_3:32>>),
  579:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout:32>>),
  580:     receive
  581:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  582:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  583:             io:format("Elapsed: ~p Timeout: ~p\n", [Elapsed,Timeout]),
  584:             if
  585:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  586:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  587:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  588:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  589:                 true ->
  590:                     try_timeouts(Port, Timeout div 2)
  591:             end
  592:     after Timeout + 100*?delay ->
  593:               ct:fail("driver failed to timeout")
  594:     end.
  595: 
  596: 
  597: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  598: %% 		Queue test suites
  599: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  600: 
  601: %% 1) Queue up data in a driver that uses the full driver_queue API to do this.
  602: %% 2) Get the data back, a random amount at a time.
  603: queue_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  604:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  605:     Name = 'queue_drv',
  606:     P = start_driver(Config, Name, true),
  607: 
  608:     q_echo(P, [{?ENQ, {list,1}},
  609:                {?ENQ, {list,0}},
  610:                {?ENQ, {bin,0}},
  611:                {?ENQ, {bin,1}},
  612:                {?ENQ, {bin,2}},
  613:                {?ENQ, {bin,3}},
  614:                {?ENQ, {bin,4}},
  615:                {?ENQ, {bin,5}},
  616:                {?ENQ, {bin,600}},
  617:                {?PUSHQ, {list,0}},
  618:                {?PUSHQ, {list,1}},
  619:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,0}},
  620:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,1}},
  621:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,888}},
  622:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,0}},
  623:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,1}},
  624:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,2}},
  625:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,3}},
  626:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,4}},
  627:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,777}},
  628:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,0}},
  629:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,1}},
  630:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,334}},
  631:                {?ENQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1},{bin,555}]},
  632:                {?ENQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1}]},
  633:                {?PUSHQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1},{bin,319}]}]),
  634: 
  635:     stop_driver(P, Name),
  636:     ok.
  637: 
  638: q_echo(Port, SpecList) ->
  639:     io:format("Heap binaries"),
  640:     HeapData = [{M,build_data(T)} || {M,T} <- SpecList],
  641:     {HeapDataReturn,HeapDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, HeapData),
  642:     dequeue(Port, HeapDataReturn, HeapDataLen, 1),
  643: 
  644:     %% Try sub binaries.
  645:     io:format("Sub binaries of heap binaries"),
  646:     SubHeapData = make_sub_binaries(HeapData),
  647:     %% The following line will generate a warning.
  648:     {HeapDataReturn,HeapDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, SubHeapData),
  649:     dequeue(Port, HeapDataReturn, HeapDataLen, 1),
  650: 
  651:     %% Try refc binaries.
  652:     io:format("Refc binaries"),
  653:     RefcData = make_refc_binaries(HeapData),
  654:     {RefcDataReturn,RefcDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, RefcData),
  655:     dequeue(Port, RefcDataReturn, RefcDataLen, 1),
  656: 
  657:     %% Try sub binaries of refc binaries.
  658:     io:format("Sub binaries of refc binaries"),
  659:     SubRefcData = make_sub_binaries(RefcData),
  660:     {RefcDataReturn,RefcDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, SubRefcData),
  661:     dequeue(Port, RefcDataReturn, RefcDataLen, 1),
  662: 
  663:     %% Try a writable binary.
  664:     io:format("Writable binaries"),
  665:     WritableBinData = make_writable_binaries(HeapData),
  666:     {WritableDataReturn,WritableDatalen} = feed_driver(Port, WritableBinData),
  667:     _ = append_to_writable_binaries(WritableBinData),
  668:     dequeue(Port, WritableDataReturn, WritableDatalen, 1),
  669: 
  670:     %% Try dequeing more than one byte at the time.
  671:     io:format("Heap binaries -- dequeueing more than one byte at the time"),
  672:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 2),
  673:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 3),
  674:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 4),
  675: 
  676:     io:format("\n").
  677: 
  678: feed_and_dequeue(Port, Data, DeqSize) ->
  679:     {DataReturn,DataLen} = feed_driver(Port, Data),
  680:     dequeue(Port, DataReturn, DataLen, DeqSize),
  681:     ok.
  682: 
  683: %% Send all data according to the specification to the driver side (where it
  684: %% is queued up for later return to this process).    
  685: 
  686: feed_driver(Port, Description) ->
  687:     feed_driver(Port, Description, <<>>, 0).
  688: 
  689: feed_driver(Port, [], ExpectedInPort, Qb) ->
  690:     io:format("Expected in port: ~P", [ExpectedInPort,12]),
  691:     io:format("In port: ~P", [read_head(Port, Qb),12]),
  692:     {ExpectedInPort,Qb};
  693: feed_driver(Port, [{Method0,Data}|T], Expected_return, Qb_before) ->
  694:     Method = case Method0 of
  695:                  ?RANDOM -> uniform(6)-1;
  696:                  Other -> Other
  697:              end,
  698:     Size = size(list_to_binary([Data])),
  699: 
  700:     %% ***********************************************************************
  701:     %% NOTE! Never never never change this to io:format/2, as that will imply
  702:     %% message sending, and sending as message will spoil the test of
  703:     %% writable binaries.
  704: 
  705:     %% erlang:display({sending,method_name(Method),Data}),
  706:     %% ***********************************************************************
  707: 
  708:     queue_op(Port, Method, Data),
  709: 
  710:     Qb_in_driver = bytes_queued(Port),
  711:     case Qb_before + Size of
  712:         Qb_in_driver -> ok;
  713:         Sum ->
  714:             ct:fail("Qb_before: ~p\n"
  715:                     "Qb_before+Size: ~p\n"
  716:                     "Qb_in_driver: ~p",
  717:                     [Qb_before,Sum,Qb_in_driver])
  718:     end,
  719:     X_return = case Method of
  720:                    ?ENQ -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data]);
  721:                    ?PUSHQ -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  722:                    ?PUSHQ_BIN -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  723:                    ?ENQ_BIN -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data]);
  724:                    ?PUSHQV -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  725:                    ?ENQV -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data])
  726:                end,
  727:     feed_driver(Port, T, X_return, Qb_before + Size).
  728: 
  729: %% method_name(0) -> pushq;
  730: %% method_name(1) -> enq;
  731: %% method_name(2) -> pushq_bin;
  732: %% method_name(3) -> enq_bin;
  733: %% method_name(4) -> pushqv;
  734: %% method_name(5) -> enqv.
  735: 
  736: dequeue(Port, DataList, LenToGet, DeqSize) ->
  737:     io:format("Dequeuing ~p bytes, ~p byte(s) at once...", [LenToGet,DeqSize]),
  738:     compare_return(Port, DataList, LenToGet, DeqSize).
  739: 
  740: compare_return(Port, _Data_list, 0, _Back_len) ->
  741:     0 = bytes_queued(Port);
  742: compare_return(Port, QueuedInPort0, Len_to_get, DeqSize) ->
  743:     case bytes_queued(Port) of
  744:         Len_to_get -> ok;
  745:         BytesInQueue ->
  746:             ct:fail("Len_to_get: ~p\nBytes in queue: ~p", [Len_to_get,BytesInQueue])
  747:     end,
  748:     BytesToDequeue = if (DeqSize > Len_to_get) -> Len_to_get;
  749:                         true -> DeqSize
  750:                      end,
  751:     Dequeued = read_head(Port, BytesToDequeue),
  752:     case bin_prefix(Dequeued, QueuedInPort0) of
  753:         true ->
  754:             deq(Port, BytesToDequeue),
  755:             <<_:BytesToDequeue/binary,QueuedInPort/binary>> = QueuedInPort0,
  756:             compare_return(Port, QueuedInPort, Len_to_get - BytesToDequeue, DeqSize);
  757:         false ->
  758:             ct:fail("Bytes to dequeue: ~p\nDequeued: ~p\nQueued in port: ~P",
  759:                     [BytesToDequeue, Dequeued, QueuedInPort0,12])
  760:     end.
  761: 
  762: %% bin_prefix(PrefixBinary, Binary)
  763: %%  Is PrefixBinary a prefix of Binary?
  764: 
  765: bin_prefix(<<C:8,PreTail/binary>>, <<C:8,Tail/binary>>) ->
  766:     bin_prefix(PreTail, Tail);
  767: bin_prefix(<<>>, _Bin) -> true;
  768: bin_prefix(_, _) -> false.
  769: 
  770: queue_op(Port, Method, Data) ->
  771:     [] = erlang:port_control(Port, Method, []),
  772:     Port ! {self(),{command,Data}},
  773:     ok.
  774: 
  775: bytes_queued(Port) ->
  776:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?BYTES_QUEUED, []) of
  777:         <<I:32>> -> I;
  778:         Bad -> ct:fail({bad_result,Bad})
  779:     end.
  780: 
  781: deq(Port, Size) ->
  782:     [] = erlang:port_control(Port, ?DEQ, <<Size:32>>).
  783: 
  784: read_head(Port, Size) ->
  785:     erlang:port_control(Port, ?READ_HEAD, <<Size:32>>).
  786: 
  787: 
  788: driver_unloaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  789:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  790:     Drv = timer_drv,
  791:     User = self(),
  792:     Loaded = make_ref(),
  793:     Die = make_ref(),
  794:     Loader = spawn(fun () ->
  795:                            erl_ddll:start(),
  796:                            ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir,
  797:                                                                 Config),
  798:                                             Drv),
  799:                            User ! Loaded,
  800:                            receive Die -> exit(bye) end
  801:                    end),
  802:     receive Loaded -> ok end,
  803:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  804:     Loader ! Die,
  805:     receive
  806:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
  807:             driver_unloaded = Reason
  808:             %% Reason used to be -1
  809:     end.
  810: 
  811: 
  812: io_ready_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  813:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  814:     Test = self(),
  815:     Dgawd = spawn(fun () ->
  816:                           ok = dgawd_handler:install(),
  817:                           Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Test),
  818:                           Test ! dgawd_handler_started,
  819:                           receive
  820:                               {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} -> ok;
  821:                               stop_dgawd_handler -> ok
  822:                           end,
  823:                           dgawd_handler:restore(),
  824:                           Test ! dgawd_handler_stopped
  825:                   end),
  826:     receive dgawd_handler_started -> ok end,
  827:     Drv = io_ready_exit_drv,
  828:     erl_ddll:start(),
  829:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
  830:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  831:     case erlang:port_control(Port, 0, "") of
  832:         "ok" ->
  833:             receive
  834:                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
  835:                     case Reason of
  836:                         ready_output_driver_failure ->
  837:                             io:format("Exited in output_ready()~n"),
  838:                             ok;
  839:                         ready_input_driver_failure ->
  840:                             io:format("Exited in input_ready()~n"),
  841:                             ok;
  842:                         Error -> ct:fail(Error)
  843:                     end
  844:             end,
  845:             receive after 2000 -> ok end,
  846:             false = dgawd_handler:got_dgawd_report(),
  847:             Dgawd ! stop_dgawd_handler,
  848:             receive dgawd_handler_stopped -> ok end,
  849:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  850:             ok;
  851:         "nyiftos" ->
  852:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  853:             {skipped, "Not yet implemented for this OS"};
  854:         Error ->
  855:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  856:             ct:fail({unexpected_control_result, Error})
  857:     end.
  858: 
  859: 
  860: -define(CHKIO_STOP, 0).
  861: -define(CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET, 1).
  862: -define(CHKIO_BAD_FD_IN_POLLSET, 2).
  863: -define(CHKIO_FD_CHANGE, 4).
  864: -define(CHKIO_STEAL, 5).
  865: -define(CHKIO_STEAL_AUX, 6).
  866: -define(CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, 7).
  867: -define(CHKIO_DRV_USE, 8).
  868: 
  869: use_fallback_pollset() ->
  870:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  871: 
  872: use_fallback_pollset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  873:     rpc(Config, fun() -> use_fallback_pollset_t(Config) end).
  874: 
  875: use_fallback_pollset_t(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  876:     FlbkFun = fun () ->
  877:                       {Flbk, _} = get_fallback(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
  878:                       case lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, Flbk) of
  879:                           {value, {total_poll_set_size, N}} when N > 0 ->
  880:                               ok;
  881:                           Error ->
  882:                               ct:fail({failed_to_use_fallback, Error})
  883:                       end
  884:               end,
  885:     {BckupTest, Handel, OkRes}
  886:     = case chkio_test_init(Config) of
  887:           {erts_poll_info, ChkIo} = Hndl ->
  888:               case lists:keysearch(fallback, 1, ChkIo) of
  889:                   {value, {fallback, B}} when B =/= false ->
  890:                       {FlbkFun, Hndl, ok};
  891:                   _ ->
  892:                       {fun () -> ok end,
  893:                        Hndl,
  894:                        {comment,
  895:                         "This implementation does not use "
  896:                         "a fallback pollset"}}
  897:               end;
  898:           Skip ->
  899:               {fun () -> ok end, Skip, ok}
  900:       end,
  901:     io:format("Node = ~p~n",[node()]),
  902:     case chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(Handel,
  903:                                     ?CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET,
  904:                                     fun () ->
  905:                                             sleep(1000),
  906:                                             BckupTest()
  907:                                     end)) of
  908:         {skipped, _} = Res -> Res;
  909:         _ -> OkRes
  910:     end.
  911: 
  912: bad_fd_in_pollset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  913:     rpc(Config,
  914:         fun() ->
  915:                 chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(chkio_test_init(Config),
  916:                                            ?CHKIO_BAD_FD_IN_POLLSET,
  917:                                            fun () -> sleep(1000) end))
  918:         end).
  919: 
  920: fd_change(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  921:     rpc(Config,
  922:         fun() ->
  923:                 chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(chkio_test_init(Config),
  924:                                            ?CHKIO_FD_CHANGE,
  925:                                            fun () -> sleep(1000) end))
  926:         end).
  927: 
  928: steal_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  929:     rpc(Config,
  930:         fun() ->
  931:                 chkio_test_fini(case chkio_test_init(Config) of
  932:                                     {erts_poll_info, _} = Hndl ->
  933:                                         steal_control_test(Hndl);
  934:                                     Skip ->
  935:                                         Skip
  936:                                 end)
  937:         end).
  938: 
  939: steal_control_test(Hndl = {erts_poll_info, Before}) ->
  940:     Port = open_chkio_port(),
  941:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STEAL_AUX, "") of
  942:         [$f,$d,$s,$:| _] = FdList ->
  943:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  944:             sleep(500),
  945:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  946:             Res = chkio_test(Hndl,
  947:                              ?CHKIO_STEAL,
  948:                              FdList,
  949:                              fun () ->
  950:                                      chk_chkio_port(Port),
  951:                                      sleep(500),
  952:                                      chk_chkio_port(Port)
  953:                              end),
  954:             case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STOP, "") of
  955:                 "ok" ->
  956:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
  957:                     ok;
  958:                 StopErr ->
  959:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
  960:                     ct:fail({stop_error, StopErr})
  961:             end,
  962:             close_chkio_port(Port),
  963:             Res;
  964:         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$\ |Skip] ->
  965:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  966:             close_chkio_port(Port),
  967:             {chkio_test_result,
  968:              {skipped, Skip},
  969:              Before};
  970:         StartErr ->
  971:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  972:             ct:fail({start_error, StartErr})
  973:     end.
  974: 
  975: chkio_test_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  976:     ChkIo = get_stable_check_io_info(),
  977:     case catch lists:keysearch(name, 1, ChkIo) of
  978:         {value, {name, erts_poll}} ->
  979:             ct:log("Before test: ~p~n", [ChkIo]),
  980:             Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  981:             erl_ddll:start(),
  982:             ok = load_driver(Path, 'chkio_drv'),
  983:             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  984:             {erts_poll_info, ChkIo};
  985:         _ ->
  986:             {skipped, "Test written to test erts_poll() which isn't used"}
  987:     end.
  988: 
  989: 
  990: chkio_test_fini({skipped, _} = Res) ->
  991:     Res;
  992: chkio_test_fini({chkio_test_result, Res, Before}) ->
  993:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver('chkio_drv'),
  994:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
  995:     After = get_stable_check_io_info(),
  996:     io:format("After test: ~p~n", [After]),
  997:     verify_chkio_state(Before, After),
  998:     Res.
  999: 
 1000: open_chkio_port() ->
 1001:     open_port({spawn, 'chkio_drv'}, []).
 1002: 
 1003: close_chkio_port(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1004:     true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1005:     receive
 1006:         {'EXIT', Port, normal} ->
 1007:             ok;
 1008:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 1009:             ct:fail({abnormal_port_exit, Port, Reason});
 1010:         {Port, Message} ->
 1011:             ct:fail({strange_message_from_port, Message})
 1012:     end.
 1013: 
 1014: chk_chkio_port(Port) ->
 1015:     receive
 1016:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} when Reason /= normal ->
 1017:             ct:fail({port_exited, Port, Reason})
 1018:     after 0 ->
 1019:               ok
 1020:     end.
 1021: 
 1022: 
 1023: chkio_test({skipped, _} = Res, _Test, _Fun) ->
 1024:     Res;
 1025: chkio_test({erts_poll_info, _Before} = EPI, Test, Fun) when is_integer(Test) ->
 1026:     chkio_test(EPI, Test, "", Fun).
 1027: 
 1028: chkio_test({skipped, _} = Res, _Test, _TestArgs, _Fun) ->
 1029:     Res;
 1030: chkio_test({erts_poll_info, Before},
 1031:            Test,
 1032:            TestArgs,
 1033:            Fun) when is_integer(Test),
 1034:                      is_list(TestArgs) ->
 1035:     Port = open_chkio_port(),
 1036:     case erlang:port_control(Port, Test, TestArgs) of
 1037:         "ok" ->
 1038:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1039:             Fun(),
 1040:             During = get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
 1041: 
 1042:             [0 = element(1, erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)) ||
 1043:                 %% The pollset is not stable when running the fallback testcase
 1044:                 Test /= ?CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET],
 1045:             ct:log("During test: ~p~n", [During]),
 1046:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1047:             case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STOP, "") of
 1048:                 Res when is_list(Res) ->
 1049:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1050:                     io:format("~s", [Res]),
 1051:                     close_chkio_port(Port),
 1052:                     Res,
 1053:                     case Res of
 1054:                         [$c,$o,$m,$m,$e,$n,$t,$:,$\ |Cmnt] ->
 1055:                             {chkio_test_result,
 1056:                              {comment, Cmnt},
 1057:                              Before};
 1058:                         _ ->
 1059:                             {chkio_test_result,
 1060:                              Res,
 1061:                              Before}
 1062:                     end;
 1063:                 StopErr ->
 1064:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1065:                     ct:fail({stop_error, StopErr})
 1066:             end;
 1067:         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$\ |Skip] ->
 1068:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1069:             close_chkio_port(Port),
 1070:             {chkio_test_result,
 1071:              {skipped, Skip},
 1072:              Before};
 1073:         StartErr ->
 1074:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1075:             ct:fail({start_error, StartErr})
 1076:     end.
 1077: 
 1078: verify_chkio_state(Before, After) ->
 1079:     TotSetSize = lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, Before),
 1080:     TotSetSize = lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, After),
 1081:     case lists:keysearch(fallback, 1, Before) of
 1082:         {value,{fallback,false}} ->
 1083:             ok;
 1084:         _ ->
 1085:             BckupSetSize = lists:keysearch(fallback_poll_set_size,
 1086:                                            1,
 1087:                                            Before),
 1088:             BckupSetSize = lists:keysearch(fallback_poll_set_size,
 1089:                                            1,
 1090:                                                        After)
 1091:     end,
 1092:     ok.
 1093: 
 1094: get_stable_check_io_info() ->
 1095:     get_stable_check_io_info(10).
 1096: get_stable_check_io_info(0) ->
 1097:     get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io));
 1098: get_stable_check_io_info(N) ->
 1099:     ChkIo = get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
 1100:     PendUpdNo = proplists:get_value(pending_updates, ChkIo, 0),
 1101:     ActFds = proplists:get_value(active_fds, ChkIo),
 1102:     case {PendUpdNo, ActFds} of
 1103:         {0, 0} ->
 1104:             ChkIo;
 1105:         _ ->
 1106:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1107:             get_stable_check_io_info(N-1)
 1108:     end.
 1109: 
 1110: %% Merge return from erlang:system_info(check_io)
 1111: %% as if it was one big pollset.
 1112: get_check_io_total(ChkIo) ->
 1113:     ct:log("ChkIo = ~p (~p)~n",[ChkIo, nodes()]),
 1114:     {Fallback, Rest} = get_fallback(ChkIo),
 1115:     OnlyPollThreads = [PS || PS <- Rest, not is_scheduler_pollset(PS)],
 1116:     add_fallback_infos(Fallback,
 1117:       lists:foldl(
 1118:         fun(Pollset, Acc) ->
 1119:                 lists:zipwith(fun(A, B) ->
 1120:                                       add_pollset_infos(A,B)
 1121:                               end,
 1122:                               Pollset, Acc)
 1123:         end,
 1124:         hd(OnlyPollThreads), tl(OnlyPollThreads))).
 1125: 
 1126: is_scheduler_pollset(Pollset) ->
 1127:     proplists:get_value(poll_threads, Pollset) == 0.
 1128: 
 1129: add_pollset_infos({Tag, A}=TA , {Tag, B}=TB) ->
 1130:     case tag_type(Tag) of
 1131:         sum ->
 1132:             {Tag, A + B};
 1133:         const ->
 1134:             case A of
 1135:                 B -> TA;
 1136:                 _ ->
 1137:                     ct:fail("Unexpected diff in pollsets ~p != ~p",
 1138:                             [TA,TB])
 1139:             end
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: get_fallback([MaybeFallback | ChkIo] = AllChkIo) ->
 1143:     case proplists:get_value(fallback, MaybeFallback) of
 1144:         true ->
 1145:             {MaybeFallback, ChkIo};
 1146:         false ->
 1147:             {undefined, AllChkIo}
 1148:     end.
 1149: 
 1150: add_fallback_infos(undefined, Acc) ->
 1151:     Acc;
 1152: add_fallback_infos(Flbk, Acc) ->
 1153:     lists:zipwith(fun({Tag, A}=TA, {Tag, B}=TB) ->
 1154:                           case tag_type(Tag) of
 1155:                               sum -> {Tag, A + B};
 1156:                               const when Tag =:= fallback -> TA;
 1157:                               const -> TB
 1158:                           end
 1159:                   end,
 1160:                   Flbk, Acc).
 1161: 
 1162: tag_type(name) -> const;
 1163: tag_type(primary) -> const;
 1164: tag_type(fallback) -> const;
 1165: tag_type(kernel_poll) -> const;
 1166: tag_type(memory_size) -> sum;
 1167: tag_type(total_poll_set_size) -> sum;
 1168: tag_type(lazy_updates) -> const;
 1169: tag_type(pending_updates) -> sum;
 1170: tag_type(batch_updates) -> const;
 1171: tag_type(concurrent_updates) -> const;
 1172: tag_type(max_fds) -> const;
 1173: tag_type(active_fds) -> sum;
 1174: tag_type(poll_threads) -> sum.
 1175: 
 1176: 
 1177: %% Missed port lock when stealing control of fd from a
 1178: %% driver that didn't use the same lock. The lock checker
 1179: %% used to trigger on this and dump core.
 1180: otp_6602(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1181:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1182:     Done = make_ref(),
 1183:     Parent = self(),
 1184:     Tester = spawn_link(Node,
 1185:                         fun () ->
 1186:                                 %% Inet driver use port locking...
 1187:                                 {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0),
 1188:                                 {ok, Fd} = inet:getfd(S),
 1189:                                 %% Steal fd (lock checker used to
 1190:                                 %% trigger here).
 1191:                                 {ok, _S2} = gen_udp:open(0,[{fd,Fd}]),
 1192:                                 Parent ! Done
 1193:                         end),
 1194:     receive Done -> ok end,
 1195:     unlink(Tester),
 1196:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1197:     ok.
 1198: 
 1199: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1,
 1200:         ["drv_drv_vsn",
 1201:          "emu_drv_vsn",
 1202:          "erts_vsn",
 1203:          "otp_vsn",
 1204:          "thread",
 1205:          "smp"]).
 1206: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2,
 1207:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1 ++
 1208:          ["async_thrs",
 1209:           "sched_thrs"])).
 1210: 
 1211: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3,
 1212:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2 ++
 1213:          ["emu_nif_vsn"])).
 1214: 
 1215: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES4,
 1216:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3 ++
 1217:          ["dirty_sched"])).
 1218: 
 1219: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES, ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES4).
 1220: 
 1221: 'driver_system_info_base_ver'(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1222:  driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_base_drv).
 1223: 
 1224: 'driver_system_info_prev_ver'(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1225:  driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_prev_drv).
 1226: 
 1227: driver_system_info_current_ver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1228:     driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_curr_drv).
 1229: 
 1230: driver_system_info_test(Config, Name) ->
 1231:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1232:     case erlang:port_control(Port, 0, []) of
 1233:         [$o,$k,$:,_ | Result] ->
 1234:             check_driver_system_info_result(Result);
 1235:         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,_ | Error] ->
 1236:             ct:fail(Error);
 1237:         Unexpected ->
 1238:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, Unexpected})
 1239:     end,
 1240:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1241:     ok.
 1242: 
 1243: check_driver_system_info_result(Result) ->
 1244:     io:format("All names: ~p~n", [?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES]),
 1245:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Result]),
 1246:     {[], Ns, DDVSN} = chk_sis(lists:map(fun (Str) ->
 1247:                                                 string:lexemes(Str, "=")
 1248:                                         end,
 1249:                                         string:lexemes(Result, " ")),
 1250:                               ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES),
 1251:     case {DDVSN,
 1252:           drv_vsn_str2tup(erlang:system_info(driver_version))} of
 1253:         {DDVSN, DDVSN} ->
 1254:             [] = Ns;
 1255:         %% {{1, 0}, _} ->
 1256:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1257:         %% 				   -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1),
 1258:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns);
 1259:         %% {{1, 1}, _} ->
 1260:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1261:         %% 				   -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2),
 1262:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns);
 1263:         {{3, 0}, _} ->
 1264:             ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1265:                                -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3),
 1266:             ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns)
 1267:     end.
 1268: 
 1269: chk_sis(SIs, Ns) ->
 1270:     chk_sis(SIs, Ns, unknown).
 1271: 
 1272: chk_sis(SIs, [], DDVSN) ->
 1273:     {SIs, [], DDVSN};
 1274: chk_sis([], Ns, DDVSN) ->
 1275:     {[], Ns, DDVSN};
 1276: chk_sis([[N, _] = SI| SIs], Ns, DDVSN) ->
 1277:     true = lists:member(N, Ns),
 1278:     case check_si_res(SI) of
 1279:         {driver_version, NewDDVSN} ->
 1280:             chk_sis(SIs, lists:delete(N, Ns), NewDDVSN);
 1281:         _ ->
 1282:             chk_sis(SIs, lists:delete(N, Ns), DDVSN)
 1283:     end.
 1284: 
 1285: %% Data in first version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.0)
 1286: check_si_res(["drv_drv_vsn", Value]) ->
 1287:     DDVSN = drv_vsn_str2tup(Value),
 1288:     {Major, DMinor} = DDVSN,
 1289:     {Major, EMinor} = drv_vsn_str2tup(erlang:system_info(driver_version)),
 1290:     true = DMinor =< EMinor,
 1291:     {driver_version, DDVSN};
 1292: check_si_res(["emu_drv_vsn", Value]) ->
 1293:     Value = erlang:system_info(driver_version);
 1294: check_si_res(["erts_vsn", Value]) ->
 1295:     Value = erlang:system_info(version);
 1296: check_si_res(["otp_vsn", Value]) ->
 1297:     Value = erlang:system_info(otp_release);
 1298: check_si_res(["thread", "true"]) ->
 1299:     true = erlang:system_info(threads);
 1300: check_si_res(["thread", "false"]) ->
 1301:     false = erlang:system_info(threads);
 1302: check_si_res(["smp", "true"]) ->
 1303:     true = erlang:system_info(smp_support);
 1304: 
 1305: %% Data added in second version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.1)
 1306: check_si_res(["async_thrs", Value]) ->
 1307:     Value = integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(thread_pool_size));
 1308: check_si_res(["sched_thrs", Value]) ->
 1309:     Value = integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(schedulers));
 1310: 
 1311: %% Data added in 3rd version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.5)
 1312: check_si_res(["emu_nif_vsn", Value]) ->
 1313:     Value = erlang:system_info(nif_version);
 1314: 
 1315: %% Data added in 4th version of driver_system_info() (driver version 3.1)
 1316: check_si_res(["dirty_sched", _Value]) ->
 1317:     true;
 1318: 
 1319: check_si_res(Unexpected) ->
 1320:     ct:fail({unexpected_result, Unexpected}).
 1321: 
 1322: -define(MON_OP_I_AM_IPID,1).
 1323: -define(MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,2).
 1324: -define(MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,3).
 1325: -define(MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,4).
 1326: -define(MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,5).
 1327: 
 1328: %% Test monitoring of processes from drivers
 1329: driver_monitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1330:     Name = monitor_drv,
 1331:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1332:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_I_AM_IPID,[]),
 1333:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1334:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1335:     {monitors, []} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1336: 
 1337:     "ok:"++Id1 = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]),
 1338:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1339:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id1),
 1340:     {monitored_by, [Port]} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1341:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1342:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1343: 
 1344:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1345:     Me = self(),
 1346:     {Pid1,Ref1} =
 1347:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1348:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]), 
 1349:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1350:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) 
 1351:                   end),
 1352:     ok = receive
 1353:              "ok" ->
 1354:                  ok
 1355:          after 1000 ->
 1356:                    timeout
 1357:          end,
 1358:     ok = receive
 1359:              {monitored_by, L} ->
 1360:                  L2 = lists:sort(L),
 1361:                  L3 = lists:sort([Me,Port]),
 1362:                  case L2 of
 1363:                      L3 ->
 1364:                          ok;
 1365:                      _ ->
 1366:                          mismatch
 1367:                  end
 1368:          after 1000 ->
 1369:                    timeout
 1370:          end,
 1371:     ok = receive
 1372:              {monitors, LL} ->
 1373:                  LL2 = lists:sort(LL),
 1374:                  LL3 = lists:sort([{process,Me},{process,Pid1}]),
 1375:                  case LL2 of
 1376:                      LL3 ->
 1377:                          ok;
 1378:                      _ ->
 1379:                          mismatch
 1380:                  end
 1381:          after 1000 ->
 1382:                    timeout
 1383:          end,
 1384:     ok = receive
 1385:              {'DOWN', Ref1, process, Pid1, _} ->
 1386:                  ok
 1387:          after 1000 ->
 1388:                    timeout
 1389:          end,
 1390:     ok = receive
 1391:              {monitor_fired,Port,Pid1} ->
 1392:                  ok
 1393:          after 1000 ->
 1394:                    timeout
 1395:          end,
 1396:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1397:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1398:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1399: 
 1400:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1401:     {Pid2,Ref2} =
 1402:     spawn_monitor(fun() -> 			       
 1403:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1404:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]), 
 1405:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1406:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) 
 1407:                   end),
 1408:     Pid2 ! go,
 1409:     {ok,Id2} = receive
 1410:                    "ok:"++II ->
 1411:                        {ok,II}
 1412:                after 1000 ->
 1413:                          timeout
 1414:                end,
 1415:     ok = receive
 1416:              {monitored_by, [Me]} ->
 1417:                  ok
 1418:          after 1000 ->
 1419:                    timeout
 1420:          end,
 1421:     ok = receive
 1422:              {monitors, [{process,Me}]} ->
 1423:                  ok
 1424:          after 1000 ->
 1425:                    timeout
 1426:          end,
 1427:     ok = receive
 1428:              {'DOWN', Ref2, process, Pid2, _} ->
 1429:                  ok
 1430:          after 1000 ->
 1431:                    timeout
 1432:          end,
 1433:     "noproc" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id2),
 1434:     {monitors,[{process,Me}]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1435:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1436:     "not_monitored" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1437:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1438:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1439: 
 1440: 
 1441:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1442:     {Pid3,Ref3} =
 1443:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1444:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1445:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]), 
 1446:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1447:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) ,
 1448:                           receive die -> ok end
 1449:                   end),
 1450:     Pid3 ! go,
 1451:     {ok,Id3} = receive
 1452:                    "ok:"++III ->
 1453:                        {ok,III}
 1454:                after 1000 ->
 1455:                          timeout
 1456:                end,
 1457:     ok = receive
 1458:              {monitored_by, [Me]} ->
 1459:                  ok
 1460:          after 1000 ->
 1461:                    timeout
 1462:          end,
 1463:     ok = receive
 1464:              {monitors, [{process,Me}]} ->
 1465:                  ok
 1466:          after 1000 ->
 1467:                    timeout
 1468:          end,
 1469:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id3),
 1470:     LLL1 = lists:sort([{process,Me},{process,Pid3}]),
 1471:     {monitors,LLL2} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1472:     LLL1 = lists:sort(LLL2),
 1473:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1474:     {monitors,[{process,Pid3}]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1475:     Pid3 ! die,
 1476:     ok = receive
 1477:              {'DOWN', Ref3, process, Pid3, _} ->
 1478:                  ok
 1479:          after 1000 ->
 1480:                    timeout
 1481:          end,
 1482:     "not_found" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id2),
 1483:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1484:     "not_monitored" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1485:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1486:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1487: 
 1488:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1489:     ok.
 1490: 
 1491: 
 1492: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT, 1).
 1493: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT, 2).
 1494: -define(IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT, 3).
 1495: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_ASYNC, 4).
 1496: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT_ASYNC, 6).
 1497: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT_ASYNC, 7).
 1498: -define(IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT_ASYNC, 8).
 1499: 
 1500: ioq_exit_test(Config, TestNo) ->
 1501:     Drv = ioq_exit_drv,
 1502:     try
 1503:         begin
 1504:             case load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1505:                              Drv) of
 1506:                 ok -> ok;
 1507:                 {error, permanent} -> ok;
 1508:                 LoadError -> ct:fail({load_error, LoadError})
 1509:             end,
 1510:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1511:                 Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1512:                     try port_control(Port, TestNo, "") of
 1513:                         "ok" ->
 1514:                             ok;
 1515:                         "nyiftos" ->
 1516:                             throw({skipped,
 1517:                                    "Not yet implemented for "
 1518:                                    "this OS"});
 1519:                         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$ | Comment] ->
 1520:                             throw({skipped, Comment});
 1521:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error] ->
 1522:                             ct:fail(Error)
 1523:                     after
 1524:                         Port ! {self(), close},
 1525:                         receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1526:                         false = lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()),
 1527:                         ok
 1528:                     end;
 1529:                 Error ->
 1530:                     ct:fail({open_port_failed, Error})
 1531:             end
 1532:         end
 1533:     catch
 1534:         throw:Term -> Term
 1535:     after
 1536:         erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
 1537:     end.
 1538: 
 1539: ioq_exit_ready_input(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1540:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT).
 1541: 
 1542: ioq_exit_ready_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1543:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT).
 1544: 
 1545: ioq_exit_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1546:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT).
 1547: 
 1548: ioq_exit_ready_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1549:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_ASYNC).
 1550: 
 1551: ioq_exit_ready_input_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1552:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT_ASYNC).
 1553: 
 1554: ioq_exit_ready_output_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1555:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT_ASYNC).
 1556: 
 1557: ioq_exit_timeout_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1558:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT_ASYNC).
 1559:
