 1561: vsn_mismatch_test(Config, LoadResult) ->
 1562:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1563:     DrvName = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1564:     LoadResult = load_driver(Path, DrvName),
 1565:     case LoadResult of
 1566:         ok ->
 1567:             Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1568:             true = is_port(Port),
 1569:             true = port_close(Port),
 1570:             ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName);
 1571:         _ ->
 1572:             ok
 1573:     end.
 1574: 
 1575: zero_extended_marker_garb_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1576:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1577: 
 1578: invalid_extended_marker_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1579:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1580: 
 1581: larger_major_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1582:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1583: 
 1584: larger_minor_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1585:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1586: 
 1587: smaller_major_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1588:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1589: 
 1590: smaller_minor_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1591:     DrvVsnStr = erlang:system_info(driver_version),
 1592:     case drv_vsn_str2tup(DrvVsnStr) of
 1593:         {_, 0} ->
 1594:             {skipped,
 1595:              "Cannot perform test when minor driver version is 0. "
 1596:              "Current driver version is " ++ DrvVsnStr ++ "."};
 1597:         _ ->
 1598:             vsn_mismatch_test(Config, ok)
 1599:     end.
 1600: 
 1601: -define(PEEK_NONXQ_TEST, 0).
 1602: -define(PEEK_NONXQ_WAIT, 1).
 1603: 
 1604: peek_non_existing_queue(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1605:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1606:     Drv = peek_non_existing_queue_drv,
 1607:     try
 1608:         begin
 1609:             case load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1610:                              Drv) of
 1611:                 ok -> ok;
 1612:                 {error, permanent} -> ok;
 1613:                 LoadError -> ct:fail({load_error, LoadError})
 1614:             end,
 1615:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1616:                 Port1 when is_port(Port1) ->
 1617:                     try port_control(Port1, ?PEEK_NONXQ_TEST, "") of
 1618:                         "ok" ->
 1619:                             ok;
 1620:                         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$p,$e,$d,$:,$ | SkipReason] ->
 1621:                             throw({skipped, SkipReason});
 1622:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error1] ->
 1623:                             ct:fail(Error1)
 1624:                     after
 1625:                         exit(Port1, kill),
 1626:                         receive {'EXIT', Port1, _} -> ok end
 1627:                     end;
 1628:                 Error1 ->
 1629:                     ct:fail({open_port1_failed, Error1})
 1630:             end,
 1631:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1632:                 Port2 when is_port(Port2) ->
 1633:                     try port_control(Port2, ?PEEK_NONXQ_WAIT, "") of
 1634:                         "ok" ->
 1635:                             ok;
 1636:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error2] ->
 1637:                             ct:fail(Error2)
 1638:                     after
 1639:                         receive {Port2, test_successful} -> ok end,
 1640:                         Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1641:                         receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end
 1642:                     end;
 1643:                 Error2 ->
 1644:                     ct:fail({open_port2_failed, Error2})
 1645:             end
 1646:         end
 1647:     catch
 1648:         throw:Term -> Term
 1649:     after
 1650:         process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1651:         erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
 1652:     end.    
 1653: 
 1654: otp_6879(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1655:     Drv = 'otp_6879_drv',
 1656:     Parent = self(),
 1657:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
 1658:     Procs = lists:map(
 1659:               fun (No) ->
 1660:                       spawn_link(
 1661:                         fun () ->
 1662:                                 case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1663:                                     Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1664:                                         Res = otp_6879_call(Port, No, 10000),
 1665:                                         erlang:port_close(Port),
 1666:                                         Parent ! {self(), Res};
 1667:                                     _ ->
 1668:                                         Parent ! {self(),
 1669:                                                   open_port_failed}
 1670:                                 end
 1671:                         end)
 1672:               end,
 1673:               lists:seq(1,10)),
 1674:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1675:                           receive
 1676:                               {P, ok} ->
 1677:                                   ok;
 1678:                               {P, Error} ->
 1679:                                   ct:fail({P, Error})
 1680:                           end
 1681:                   end,
 1682:                   Procs),
 1683:     %% Also try it when input exceeds default buffer (256 bytes)
 1684:     Data = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 1685:     case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1686:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1687:             ok = otp_6879_call(Port, Data, 10),
 1688:             erlang:port_close(Port);
 1689:         _ ->
 1690:             ct:fail(open_port_failed)
 1691:     end,
 1692:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv),
 1693:     ok.
 1694: 
 1695: otp_6879_call(_Port, _Data, 0) ->
 1696:     ok;
 1697: otp_6879_call(Port, Data, N) ->
 1698:     case catch erlang:port_call(Port, 0, Data) of
 1699:         Data -> otp_6879_call(Port, Data, N-1);
 1700:         BadData -> {mismatch, Data, BadData}
 1701:     end.
 1702: 
 1703: caller(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1704:     run_caller_test(Config, false),
 1705:     run_caller_test(Config, true).
 1706: 
 1707: run_caller_test(Config, Outputv) ->
 1708:     Drv = 'caller_drv',
 1709:     Cmd = case Outputv of
 1710:               true ->
 1711:                   os:putenv("CALLER_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV",
 1712:                             "true"),
 1713:                   outputv;
 1714:               false ->
 1715:                   os:putenv("CALLER_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV",
 1716:                             "false"),
 1717:                   output
 1718:           end,
 1719:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
 1720:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
 1721:     true = is_port(Port),
 1722:     chk_caller(Port, start, self()),
 1723:     chk_caller(Port,
 1724:                Cmd,
 1725:                spawn_link(
 1726:                  fun () ->
 1727:                          port_command(Port, "")
 1728:                  end)),
 1729:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1730:     chk_caller(Port, Cmd, self()),
 1731:     chk_caller(Port,
 1732:                control,
 1733:                spawn_link(
 1734:                  fun () ->
 1735:                          port_control(Port, 0, "")
 1736:                  end)),
 1737:     chk_caller(Port,
 1738:                call,
 1739:                spawn_link(
 1740:                  fun () ->
 1741:                          erlang:port_call(Port, 0, "")
 1742:                  end)),
 1743:     true = port_close(Port),
 1744:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv),
 1745:     ok.
 1746: 
 1747: chk_caller(Port, Callback, ExpectedCaller) ->
 1748:     receive
 1749:         {caller, Port, Callback, Caller} ->
 1750:             ExpectedCaller = Caller
 1751:     end.
 1752: 
 1753: %% Check that many simultaneously signalled events work (win32)
 1754: many_events(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1755:     Name = 'many_events_drv',
 1756:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1757:     Number = "1000",
 1758:     Port ! {self(), {command, Number}},
 1759:     receive 
 1760:         {Port, {data,Number}} ->
 1761:             receive %% Just to make sure the emulator does not crash 
 1762:                 %% after this case is run (if faulty)
 1763:             after 2000 ->
 1764:                       ok
 1765:             end
 1766:     after 1000 ->
 1767:               exit(the_driver_does_not_respond)
 1768:     end,
 1769:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1770:     ok.
 1771: 
 1772: 
 1773: missing_callbacks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1774:     Name = 'missing_callback_drv',
 1775:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1776: 
 1777:     Port ! {self(), {command, "tjenix"}},
 1778:     true = erlang:port_command(Port, "halloj"),
 1779:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(Port, 4711, "mors")),
 1780:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_call(Port, 17, "hej")),
 1781: 
 1782:     %% Give the (non-existing) ready_output(), ready_input(), event(),
 1783:     %% and timeout() some time to be called.
 1784:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1785: 
 1786:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1787:     ok.
 1788: 
 1789: %% Test concurrent calls to driver_select.
 1790: smp_select(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
 1791:     case os:type() of
 1792:         {win32,_} -> {skipped, "Test not implemented for this OS"};
 1793:         _ -> rpc(Config, fun() -> smp_select0(Config) end)
 1794:     end.
 1795: 
 1796: smp_select0(Config) ->
 1797:     DrvName = 'chkio_drv',
 1798:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1799:     erl_ddll:start(),
 1800:     ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),    
 1801:     Master = self(),
 1802:     ProcFun = fun()-> io:format("Worker ~p starting\n",[self()]),	
 1803:                       Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1804:                       smp_select_loop(Port, 100000),
 1805:                       smp_select_done(Port),
 1806:                       true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1807:                       Master ! {ok,self()},
 1808:                       io:format("Worker ~p finished\n",[self()])
 1809:               end,
 1810:     Pids = lists:map(fun(_) -> spawn_link(ProcFun) end,
 1811:                      lists:seq(1,4)),
 1812:     TimeoutMsg = make_ref(),
 1813:     {ok,TRef} = timer:send_after(5*1000, TimeoutMsg), % Limit test duration on slow machines
 1814:     smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg),
 1815:     timer:cancel(TRef),
 1816:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1817:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1818:     ok.
 1819: 
 1820: smp_select_loop(_, 0) ->
 1821:     ok;
 1822: smp_select_loop(Port, N) ->
 1823:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, []) of
 1824:         "yield" -> erlang:yield();
 1825:         "ok" -> ok
 1826:     end,
 1827:     receive
 1828:         stop -> 
 1829:             io:format("Worker ~p stopped with ~p laps left\n",[self(), N]), 
 1830:             ok
 1831:     after 0 ->
 1832:               smp_select_loop(Port, N-1)
 1833:     end.
 1834: 
 1835: smp_select_done(Port) ->
 1836:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, "done") of
 1837:         "wait" ->
 1838:             receive
 1839:                 {Port, done} ->
 1840:                     ok
 1841:             after 10*1000 ->
 1842:                     %% Seems we have a lost ready_input event.
 1843:                     %% Go ahead anyway, port will crash VM when closed.
 1844:                     ok
 1845:             end;
 1846: 
 1847:         "ok" -> ok
 1848:     end.
 1849: 
 1850: smp_select_wait([], _) ->
 1851:     ok;
 1852: smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg) ->
 1853:     receive
 1854:         {ok,Pid} when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1855:             smp_select_wait(lists:delete(Pid,Pids), TimeoutMsg);
 1856:         TimeoutMsg ->
 1857:             lists:foreach(fun(Pid)-> Pid ! stop end,
 1858:                           Pids),
 1859:             smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg)
 1860:     end.
 1861: 
 1862: 
 1863: %% Test driver_select() with new ERL_DRV_USE flag.
 1864: driver_select_use(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
 1865:     case os:type() of
 1866:         {win32,_} -> {skipped, "Test not implemented for this OS"};
 1867:         _ -> rpc(Config, fun() -> driver_select_use0(Config) end)
 1868:     end.
 1869: 
 1870: driver_select_use0(Config) ->
 1871:     DrvName = 'chkio_drv',
 1872:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1873:     erl_ddll:start(),
 1874:     ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),    
 1875:     Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1876:     "ok" = erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_DRV_USE, []),
 1877:     {Port,{data,"TheEnd"}} = receive Msg -> Msg
 1878:                              after 10000 -> timeout end,
 1879:     true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1880:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1881:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1882:     ok.
 1883: 
 1884: lots_of_used_fds_on_boot(Config) ->
 1885:     case os:type() of
 1886:         {unix, _} -> lots_of_used_fds_on_boot_test(Config);
 1887:         _ -> {skipped, "Unix only test"}
 1888:     end.
 1889: 
 1890: lots_of_used_fds_on_boot_test(Config) ->
 1891:     %% Start a node in a wrapper which have lots of fds
 1892:     %% open. This used to hang the whole VM at boot in
 1893:     %% an eternal loop trying to figure out how to size
 1894:     %% arrays in erts_poll() implementation.
 1895:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
 1896: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
 1897: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
 1898: 	   end,
 1899:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1900:     Wrapper = filename:join(DataDir, "lots_of_fds_used_wrapper"),
 1901:     try
 1902:         {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io, exec => {Wrapper, [Prog]}}),
 1903:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1904:     catch
 1905:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 17}} ->
 1906:             {skip, "Cannot open enough fds to test this"}
 1907:     end.
 1908: 
 1909: thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1910:     case {erlang:system_info(threads),
 1911:           erlang:system_info({allocator,mseg_alloc}),
 1912:           driver_alloc_sbct()} of
 1913:         {_, false, _} ->
 1914:             {skipped, "No mseg_alloc"};
 1915:         {false, _, _} ->
 1916:             {skipped, "No threads"};
 1917:         {_, _, false} ->
 1918:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() not using the alloc_util framework"};
 1919:         {_, _, SBCT} when is_integer(SBCT), SBCT > 10*1024*1024 ->
 1920:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() using too large single block threshold"};
 1921:         {_, _, 0} ->
 1922:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() using too low single block threshold"};
 1923:         {true, _MsegAllocInfo, SBCT} ->
 1924:             DrvName = 'thr_alloc_drv',
 1925:             Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1926:             erl_ddll:start(),
 1927:             ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),   
 1928:             Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1929:             CCI = 1000,
 1930:             io:format("CCI = ~p~n", [CCI]),
 1931:             CCC = mseg_alloc_ccc(),
 1932:             io:format("CCC = ~p~n", [CCC]),
 1933:             thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean_test(Port,
 1934:                                                10,
 1935:                                                CCI,
 1936:                                                SBCT+100),
 1937:             true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1938:             ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1939:             ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1940:             ok
 1941:     end.
 1942: 
 1943: mseg_alloc_ccc() ->
 1944:     mseg_alloc_ccc(mseg_inst_info(0)).
 1945: 
 1946: mseg_alloc_ccc(MsegAllocInfo) ->
 1947:     {value,{memkind, MKL}} = lists:keysearch(memkind,1,MsegAllocInfo),
 1948:     {value,{calls, CL}} = lists:keysearch(calls, 1, MKL),
 1949:     {value,{mseg_check_cache, GigaCCC, CCC}}
 1950:     = lists:keysearch(mseg_check_cache, 1, CL),
 1951:     GigaCCC*1000000000 + CCC.
 1952: 
 1953: mseg_alloc_cached_segments() ->
 1954:     mseg_alloc_cached_segments(mseg_inst_info(0)).
 1955: 
 1956: mseg_alloc_cached_segments(MsegAllocInfo) ->
 1957:     MemName = "all memory",
 1958:     [{memkind,DrvMem}]
 1959:     = lists:filter(fun(E) -> case E of
 1960:                                  {memkind, [{name, MemName} | _]} -> true;
 1961:                                  _ -> false
 1962:                              end end, MsegAllocInfo),
 1963:     {value,{status, SL}}
 1964:     = lists:keysearch(status, 1, DrvMem),
 1965:     {value,{cached_segments, CS}}
 1966:     = lists:keysearch(cached_segments, 1, SL),
 1967:     CS.
 1968: 
 1969: mseg_inst_info(I) ->
 1970:     {value, {instance, I, Value}}
 1971:     = lists:keysearch(I,
 1972:                       2,
 1973:                       erlang:system_info({allocator,mseg_alloc})),
 1974:     Value.
 1975: 
 1976: driver_alloc_sbct() ->
 1977:     {_, _, _, As} = erlang:system_info(allocator),
 1978:     case lists:keysearch(driver_alloc, 1, As) of
 1979:         {value,{driver_alloc,DAOPTs}} ->
 1980:             case lists:keysearch(sbct, 1, DAOPTs) of
 1981:                 {value,{sbct,SBCT}} ->
 1982:                     SBCT;
 1983:                 _ ->
 1984:                     false
 1985:             end;
 1986:         _ ->
 1987:             false
 1988:     end.
 1989: 
 1990: thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean_test(_Port, 0, _CCI, _Size) ->
 1991:     ok;
 1992: thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean_test(Port, N, CCI, Size) ->
 1993:     wait_until(fun () -> 0 == mseg_alloc_cached_segments() end),
 1994:     receive after CCI+500 -> ok end,
 1995:     OCCC = mseg_alloc_ccc(),
 1996:     "ok" = erlang:port_control(Port, 0, integer_to_list(Size)),
 1997:     receive after CCI+500 -> ok end,
 1998:     CCC = mseg_alloc_ccc(),
 1999:     io:format("CCC = ~p~n", [CCC]),
 2000:     true = CCC > OCCC,
 2001:     thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean_test(Port, N-1, CCI, Size).
 2002: 
 2003: otp_9302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2004:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2005:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2006:     ok = load_driver(Path, otp_9302_drv),
 2007:     Port = open_port({spawn, otp_9302_drv}, []),
 2008:     true = is_port(Port),
 2009:     port_command(Port, ""),
 2010:     {msg, block} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2011:     {msg, job} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2012:     C = case erlang:system_info(thread_pool_size) of
 2013:             0 ->
 2014:                 {msg, cancel} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2015:                 {msg, job} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2016:                 false;
 2017:             _ ->
 2018:                 case get_port_msg(Port, infinity) of
 2019:                     {msg, cancel} -> %% Cancel always fail in Rel >= 15
 2020:                         {msg, job} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2021:                         false;
 2022:                     {msg, job} ->
 2023:                         ok,
 2024:                         true
 2025:                 end
 2026:         end,
 2027:     {msg, end_of_jobs} = get_port_msg(Port, infinity),
 2028:     no_msg = get_port_msg(Port, 2000),
 2029:     port_close(Port),
 2030:     case C of
 2031:         true ->
 2032:             {comment, "Async job cancelled"};
 2033:         false ->
 2034:             {comment, "Async job not cancelled"}
 2035:     end.
 2036: 
 2037: thr_free_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2038:     case erlang:system_info(threads) of
 2039:         false ->
 2040:             {skipped, "No thread support"};
 2041:         true ->
 2042:             thr_free_drv_do(Config)
 2043:     end.
 2044: 
 2045: thr_free_drv_do(Config) ->
 2046:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2047:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2048:     ok = load_driver(Path, thr_free_drv),
 2049:     MemBefore = driver_alloc_size(),
 2050:     %    io:format("SID=~p", [erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)]),
 2051:     Port = open_port({spawn, thr_free_drv}, []),
 2052:     MemPeek = driver_alloc_size(),
 2053:     true = is_port(Port),
 2054:     ok = thr_free_drv_control(Port, 0),
 2055:     port_close(Port),
 2056:     MemAfter = driver_alloc_size(),
 2057:     io:format("MemPeek=~p~n", [MemPeek]),
 2058:     io:format("MemBefore=~p, MemAfter=~p~n", [MemBefore, MemAfter]),
 2059:     MemBefore = MemAfter,
 2060:     case MemPeek of
 2061:         undefined -> ok;
 2062:         _ ->
 2063:             true = MemPeek > MemBefore
 2064:     end,
 2065:     ok.
 2066: 
 2067: thr_free_drv_control(Port, N) ->
 2068:     case erlang:port_control(Port, 0, "") of
 2069:         "done" ->
 2070:             ok;
 2071:         "more" ->
 2072:             erlang:yield(),
 2073:             %	    io:format("N=~p, SID=~p", [N, erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)]),
 2074:             thr_free_drv_control(Port, N+1)
 2075:     end.
 2076: 
 2077: async_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2078:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2079:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2080:     ok = load_driver(Path, async_blast_drv),
 2081:     SchedOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2082:     MemBefore = driver_alloc_size(),
 2083:     Start = os:timestamp(),
 2084:     Blast = fun () ->
 2085:                     Port = open_port({spawn, async_blast_drv}, []),
 2086:                     true = is_port(Port),
 2087:                     port_command(Port, ""),
 2088:                     receive
 2089:                         {Port, done} ->
 2090:                             ok
 2091:                     end,
 2092:                     port_close(Port)
 2093:             end,
 2094:     Ps = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 2095:                            spawn_opt(Blast,
 2096:                                      [{scheduler,
 2097:                                        (N rem SchedOnln)+ 1},
 2098:                                       monitor])
 2099:                    end,
 2100:                    lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2101:     MemMid = driver_alloc_size(),
 2102:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid, Mon}) ->
 2103:                           receive
 2104:                               {'DOWN',Mon,process,Pid,_} -> ok
 2105:                           end
 2106:                   end, Ps),
 2107:     End = os:timestamp(),
 2108:     MemAfter = driver_alloc_size(),
 2109:     ct:log("MemBefore=~p, MemMid=~p, MemAfter=~p~n",
 2110:               [MemBefore, MemMid, MemAfter]),
 2111:     AsyncBlastTime = timer:now_diff(End,Start)/1000000,
 2112:     ct:log("AsyncBlastTime=~p~n", [AsyncBlastTime]),
 2113:     MemBefore = MemAfter,
 2114:     ok.
 2115: 
 2116: thr_msg_blast_receiver(_Port, N, N) ->
 2117:     ok;
 2118: thr_msg_blast_receiver(Port, N, Max) ->
 2119:     receive
 2120:         {Port, hi} ->
 2121:             thr_msg_blast_receiver(Port, N+1, Max)
 2122:     end.
 2123: 
 2124: thr_msg_blast_receiver_proc(Port, Max, Parent, Done) ->
 2125:     case port_control(Port, 0, "") of
 2126:         "receiver" ->
 2127:             spawn(fun () ->
 2128:                           thr_msg_blast_receiver_proc(Port, Max+1, Parent, Done)
 2129:                   end),
 2130:             thr_msg_blast_receiver(Port, 0, Max);
 2131:         "done" ->
 2132:             Parent ! Done
 2133:     end.
 2134: 
 2135: thr_msg_blast() ->
 2136:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 10}}].
 2137: 
 2138: thr_msg_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2139:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2140:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2141:     ok = load_driver(Path, thr_msg_blast_drv),
 2142:     MemBefore = driver_alloc_size(),
 2143:     Start = os:timestamp(),
 2144:     Port = open_port({spawn, thr_msg_blast_drv}, []),
 2145:     true = is_port(Port),
 2146:     Done = make_ref(),
 2147:     Me = self(),
 2148:     spawn(fun () ->
 2149:                   thr_msg_blast_receiver_proc(Port, 1, Me, Done)
 2150:           end),
 2151:     receive
 2152:         Done -> ok
 2153:     end,
 2154:     ok = thr_msg_blast_receiver(Port, 0, 32*10000),
 2155:     port_close(Port),
 2156:     End = os:timestamp(),
 2157:     receive
 2158:         Garbage ->
 2159:             ct:fail({received_garbage, Port, Garbage})
 2160:     after 2000 ->
 2161:             ok
 2162:     end,
 2163:     MemAfter = driver_alloc_size(),
 2164:     ct:log("MemBefore=~p, MemAfter=~p~n",
 2165:               [MemBefore, MemAfter]),
 2166:     ThrMsgBlastTime = timer:now_diff(End,Start)/1000000,
 2167:     ct:log("ThrMsgBlastTime=~p~n", [ThrMsgBlastTime]),
 2168:     MemBefore = MemAfter,
 2169:     Res = {thr_msg_blast_time, ThrMsgBlastTime},
 2170:     Res.
 2171: 
 2172: -define(IN_RANGE(LoW_, VaLuE_, HiGh_),
 2173:         case in_range(LoW_, VaLuE_, HiGh_) of
 2174:             true -> ok;
 2175:             false ->
 2176:                 case erlang:system_info(lock_checking) of
 2177:                     true ->
 2178:                         io:format("~p:~p: Ignore bad sched count due to "
 2179:                                   "lock checking~n",
 2180:                                   [?MODULE,?LINE]);
 2181:                     false ->
 2182:                         ct:fail({unexpected_sched_counts, VaLuE_})
 2183:                 end
 2184:         end).
 2185: 
 2186: 
 2187: consume_timeslice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2188:     %%
 2189:     %% Verify that erl_drv_consume_timeslice() works.
 2190:     %%
 2191:     %% The first four cases expect that the command signal is
 2192:     %% delivered immediately, i.e., isn't scheduled. Since there
 2193:     %% are no conflicts these signals should normally be delivered
 2194:     %% immediately. However some builds and configurations may
 2195:     %% schedule these ops anyway, in these cases we do not verify
 2196:     %% scheduling counts.
 2197:     %%
 2198:     %% When signal is delivered immediately we must take into account
 2199:     %% that process and port are "virtually" scheduled out and in
 2200:     %% in the trace generated.
 2201:     %%
 2202:     %% Port ! {_, {command, _}, and port_command() differs. The send
 2203:     %% instruction needs to check if the caller is out of reductions
 2204:     %% at the end of the instruction, since no erlang function call
 2205:     %% is involved. Otherwise, a sequence of send instructions would
 2206:     %% not be scheduled out even when out of reductions. port_commond()
 2207:     %% doesn't do that since it will always (since R16A) be called via
 2208:     %% the erlang wrappers in the erlang module.
 2209:     %%
 2210:     %% The last two cases tests scheduled operations. We create
 2211:     %% a conflict by executing at the same time on different
 2212:     %% schedulers. When only one scheduler we enable parallelism on
 2213:     %% the port instead.
 2214:     %%
 2215: 
 2216:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2217:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2218:     ok = load_driver(Path, consume_timeslice_drv),
 2219:     Port = open_port({spawn, consume_timeslice_drv}, [{parallelism, false}]),
 2220: 
 2221:     Parent = self(),
 2222:     Go = make_ref(),
 2223: 
 2224:     "enabled" = port_control(Port, $E, ""),
 2225:     Proc1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2226:                                receive Go -> ok end,
 2227:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2228:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2229:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2230:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2231:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2232:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2233:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2234:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2235:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2236:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}}
 2237:                        end),
 2238:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2239:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2240:     Proc1 ! Go,
 2241:     wait_command_msgs(Port, 10),
 2242:     [{Port, Sprt1}, {Proc1, Sproc1}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port, Proc1]),
 2243:     ?IN_RANGE(10, Sprt1, 10),
 2244:     ?IN_RANGE(5, Sproc1-10, 7),
 2245: 
 2246:     "disabled" = port_control(Port, $D, ""),
 2247:     Proc2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2248:                                receive Go -> ok end,
 2249:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2250:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2251:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2252:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2253:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2254:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2255:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2256:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2257:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2258:                                Port ! {Parent, {command, ""}}
 2259:                        end),
 2260:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2261:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2262:     Proc2 ! Go,
 2263:     wait_command_msgs(Port, 10),
 2264:     [{Port, Sprt2}, {Proc2, Sproc2}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port, Proc2]),
 2265:     ?IN_RANGE(10, Sprt2, 10),
 2266:     ?IN_RANGE(1, Sproc2-10, 2),
 2267: 
 2268:     "enabled" = port_control(Port, $E, ""),
 2269:     Proc3 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2270:                                receive Go -> ok end,
 2271:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2272:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2273:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2274:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2275:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2276:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2277:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2278:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2279:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2280:                                port_command(Port, "")
 2281:                        end),
 2282:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2283:     Proc3 ! Go,
 2284:     wait_command_msgs(Port, 10),
 2285:     [{Port, Sprt3}, {Proc3, Sproc3}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port, Proc3]),
 2286:     ?IN_RANGE(10, Sprt3, 10),
 2287:     ?IN_RANGE(5, Sproc3-10, 7),
 2288: 
 2289:     "disabled" = port_control(Port, $D, ""),
 2290:     Proc4 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2291:                                receive Go -> ok end,
 2292:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2293:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2294:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2295:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2296:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2297:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2298:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2299:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2300:                                port_command(Port, ""),
 2301:                                port_command(Port, "")
 2302:                        end),
 2303:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2304:     Proc4 ! Go,
 2305:     wait_command_msgs(Port, 10),
 2306:     [{Port, Sprt4}, {Proc4, Sproc4}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port, Proc4]),
 2307:     ?IN_RANGE(10, Sprt4, 10),
 2308:     ?IN_RANGE(1, Sproc4-10, 2),
 2309: 
 2310:     SOnl = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2311:     %% If only one scheduler use port with parallelism set to true,
 2312:     %% in order to trigger scheduling of command signals
 2313:     Port2 = case SOnl of
 2314:                 1 ->
 2315:                     Port ! {self(), close},
 2316:                     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 2317:                     open_port({spawn, consume_timeslice_drv},
 2318:                               [{parallelism, true}]);
 2319:                 _ ->
 2320:                     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2321:                     1 = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2322:                     Port
 2323:             end,
 2324:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2325:     "enabled" = port_control(Port2, $E, ""),
 2326:     W5 = case SOnl of
 2327:              1 ->
 2328:                  false;
 2329:              _ ->
 2330:                  W1= spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2331:                                        2 = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2332:                                        "sleeped" = port_control(Port2, $S, "")
 2333:                                end, [link,{scheduler,2}]),
 2334:                  receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2335:                  W1
 2336:          end,
 2337:     Proc5 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2338:                               receive Go -> ok end,
 2339:                               1 = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2340:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2341:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2342:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2343:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2344:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2345:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2346:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2347:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2348:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2349:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}}
 2350:                       end, [link,{scheduler,1}]),
 2351:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2352:     Proc5 ! Go,
 2353:     wait_procs_exit([W5, Proc5]),
 2354:     wait_command_msgs(Port2, 10),
 2355:     [{Port2, Sprt5}, {Proc5, Sproc5}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port2, Proc5]),
 2356:     ?IN_RANGE(2, Sproc5, 3),
 2357:     ?IN_RANGE(6, Sprt5, 20),
 2358: 
 2359:     count_pp_sched_start(),
 2360:     "disabled" = port_control(Port2, $D, ""),
 2361:     W6 = case SOnl of
 2362:              1 ->
 2363:                  false;
 2364:              _ ->
 2365:                  W2= spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2366:                                        2 = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2367:                                        "sleeped" = port_control(Port2, $S, "")
 2368:                                end, [link,{scheduler,2}]),
 2369:                  receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2370:                  W2
 2371:          end,
 2372:     Proc6 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2373:                               receive Go -> ok end,
 2374:                               1 = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2375:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2376:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2377:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2378:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2379:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2380:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2381:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2382:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2383:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}},
 2384:                               Port2 ! {Parent, {command, ""}}
 2385:                       end, [link,{scheduler,1}]),
 2386:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2387:     Proc6 ! Go,
 2388:     wait_procs_exit([W6, Proc6]),
 2389:     wait_command_msgs(Port2, 10),
 2390:     [{Port2, Sprt6}, {Proc6, Sproc6}] = count_pp_sched_stop([Port2, Proc6]),
 2391:     ?IN_RANGE(2, Sproc6, 3),
 2392:     ?IN_RANGE(2, Sprt6, 6),
 2393: 
 2394:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
 2395: 
 2396:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 2397:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 2398:     ok.
 2399: 
 2400: 
 2401: wait_command_msgs(_, 0) ->
 2402:     ok;
 2403: wait_command_msgs(Port, N) ->
 2404:     receive
 2405:         {Port, command} ->
 2406:             wait_command_msgs(Port, N-1)
 2407:     end.
 2408: 
 2409: in_range(Low, Val, High) when is_integer(Low),
 2410:                               is_integer(Val),
 2411:                               is_integer(High),
 2412:                               Low =< Val,
 2413:                               Val =< High ->
 2414:     true;
 2415: in_range(Low, Val, High) when is_integer(Low),
 2416:                               is_integer(Val),
 2417:                               is_integer(High) ->
 2418:     false.
 2419: 
 2420: count_pp_sched_start() ->
 2421:     erlang:trace(all, true, [running_procs, running_ports, {tracer, self()}]),
 2422:     ok.
 2423: 
 2424: count_pp_sched_stop(Ps) ->
 2425:     Td = erlang:trace_delivered(all),
 2426:     erlang:trace(all, false, [running_procs, running_ports, {tracer, self()}]),
 2427:     PNs = lists:map(fun (P) -> {P, 0} end, Ps),
 2428:     receive {trace_delivered, all, Td} -> ok end,
 2429:     Res = count_proc_sched(Ps, PNs),
 2430:     ct:log("Scheduling counts: ~p~n", [Res]),
 2431:     Res.
 2432: 
 2433: do_inc_pn(_P, []) ->
 2434:     throw(undefined);
 2435: do_inc_pn(P, [{P,N}|PNs]) ->
 2436:     [{P,N+1}|PNs];
 2437: do_inc_pn(P, [PN|PNs]) ->
 2438:     [PN|do_inc_pn(P, PNs)].
 2439: 
 2440: inc_pn(P, PNs) ->
 2441:     try
 2442:         do_inc_pn(P, PNs)
 2443:     catch
 2444:         throw:undefined -> PNs
 2445:     end.
 2446: 
 2447: count_proc_sched(Ps, PNs) ->
 2448:     receive
 2449:         TT when element(1, TT) == trace, element(3, TT) == in ->
 2450:             %	    erlang:display(TT),
 2451:             count_proc_sched(Ps, inc_pn(element(2, TT), PNs));
 2452:         TT when element(1, TT) == trace, element(3, TT) == out ->
 2453:             count_proc_sched(Ps, PNs)
 2454:     after 0 ->
 2455:               PNs
 2456:     end.
 2457: 
 2458: %%
 2459: %% Tests whether erl_drv_putenv reflects in os:getenv and vice versa.
 2460: %%
 2461: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2462:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), env_drv),
 2463:     Port = open_port({spawn_driver, env_drv}, []),
 2464:     true = is_port(Port),
 2465: 
 2466:     Keys = ["env_drv_a_key", "env_drv_b_key", "env_drv_c_key"],
 2467:     Values = ["a_value", "b_value", "c_value"],
 2468: 
 2469:     [env_put_test(Port, Key, Value) || Key <- Keys, Value <- Values],
 2470:     [env_get_test(Port, Key, Value) || Key <- Keys, Value <- Values],
 2471:     [env_oversize_test(Port, Key) || Key <- Keys],
 2472:     [env_notfound_test(Port, Key) || Key <- Keys],
 2473: 
 2474:     true = port_close(Port),
 2475:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(env_drv),
 2476:     ok.
 2477: 
 2478: env_control(Port, Command, Key, Value) ->
 2479:     KeyBin = list_to_binary(Key),
 2480:     ValueBin = list_to_binary(Value),
 2481:     Header = <<(byte_size(KeyBin)), (byte_size(ValueBin))>>,
 2482:     Payload = <<KeyBin/binary, ValueBin/binary>>,
 2483:     port_control(Port, Command, <<Header/binary, Payload/binary>>).
 2484: 
 2485: env_put_test(Port, Key, Value) ->
 2486:     os:unsetenv(Key),
 2487:     [0] = env_control(Port, 0, Key, Value),
 2488:     Value = os:getenv(Key).
 2489: 
 2490: env_get_test(Port, Key, ExpectedValue) ->
 2491:     true = os:putenv(Key, ExpectedValue),
 2492:     [0] = env_control(Port, 1, Key, ExpectedValue).
 2493: 
 2494: env_oversize_test(Port, Key) ->
 2495:     os:putenv(Key, [$A || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1024)]),
 2496:     [127] = env_control(Port, 1, Key, "").
 2497: 
 2498: env_notfound_test(Port, Key) ->
 2499:     true = os:unsetenv(Key),
 2500:     [255] = env_control(Port, 1, Key, "").
 2501: 
 2502: 
 2503: a_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2504:     rpc(Config, fun check_io_debug/0).
 2505: 
 2506: z_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2507:     rpc(Config, fun check_io_debug/0).
 2508: 
 2509: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2510: %% 		Utilities
 2511: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2512: 
 2513: check_io_debug() ->
 2514:     get_stable_check_io_info(),
 2515:     {NoErrorFds, NoUsedFds, NoDrvSelStructs, NoEnifSelStructs}
 2516:         = CheckIoDebug = erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug),
 2517:     HasGetHost = has_gethost(),
 2518:     ct:log("check_io_debug: ~p~n"
 2519:            "HasGetHost: ~p",[CheckIoDebug, HasGetHost]),
 2520:     0 = NoErrorFds,
 2521:     if
 2522:         NoUsedFds == NoDrvSelStructs ->
 2523:             ok;
 2524:         HasGetHost andalso (NoUsedFds == (NoDrvSelStructs - 1)) ->
 2525:             %% If the inet_gethost port is alive, we may have
 2526:             %% one extra used fd that is not selected on
 2527:             ok
 2528:     end,
 2529:     0 = NoEnifSelStructs,
 2530:     ok.
 2531: 
 2532: has_gethost() ->
 2533:     has_gethost(erlang:ports()).
 2534: has_gethost([P|T]) ->
 2535:     {name, Name} = erlang:port_info(P, name),
 2536:     case filename:basename(Name) of
 2537:         "inet_gethost"++_ ->
 2538:             true;
 2539:         _ ->
 2540:             has_gethost(T)
 2541:     end;
 2542: has_gethost([]) ->
 2543:     false.
 2544: 
 2545: %flush_msgs() ->
 2546: %    receive
 2547: %	M ->
 2548: %	    erlang:display(M),
 2549: %	    flush_msgs()
 2550: %    after 0 ->
 2551: %	    ok
 2552: %    end.
 2553: 
 2554: wait_procs_exit([]) ->
 2555:     ok;
 2556: wait_procs_exit([P|Ps]) when is_pid(P) ->
 2557:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, P),
 2558:     receive
 2559:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, P, _} ->
 2560:             wait_procs_exit(Ps)
 2561:     end;
 2562: wait_procs_exit([_|Ps]) ->
 2563:     wait_procs_exit(Ps).
 2564: 
 2565: get_port_msg(Port, Timeout) ->
 2566:     receive
 2567:         {Port, What} ->
 2568:             {msg, What}
 2569:     after Timeout ->
 2570:               no_msg
 2571:     end.
 2572: 
 2573: wait_until(Fun) ->
 2574:     case Fun() of
 2575:         true -> ok;
 2576:         false ->
 2577:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2578:             wait_until(Fun)
 2579:     end.
 2580: 
 2581: drv_vsn_str2tup(Str) ->
 2582:     [Major, Minor] = string:lexemes(Str, "."),
 2583:     {list_to_integer(Major), list_to_integer(Minor)}.
 2584: 
 2585: %% Build port data from a template.
 2586: 
 2587: build_data({bin,Size})  -> build_binary(Size);
 2588: build_data({list,Size}) -> build_list(Size);
 2589: build_data(int) -> random_char();
 2590: build_data([])  -> [];
 2591: build_data([H|T]) -> [build_data(H)|build_data(T)].
 2592: 
 2593: %% Transform all binaries in a term.
 2594: 
 2595: transform_bins(_Transform, []) -> [];
 2596: transform_bins(Transform, [H|T]) ->
 2597:     [transform_bins(Transform, H)|transform_bins(Transform, T)];
 2598: transform_bins(Transform, Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
 2599:     list_to_tuple([transform_bins(Transform, E) || E <- tuple_to_list(Tuple)]);
 2600: transform_bins(Transform, Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2601:     Transform(Bin);
 2602: transform_bins(_Transform, Other) -> Other.
 2603: 
 2604: 
 2605: %% Convert all binaries in a term to sub binaries.
 2606: 
 2607: make_sub_binaries(Term) ->
 2608:     MakeSub = fun(Bin0) ->
 2609:                       Bin1 = <<243:8,0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5,19:8>>,
 2610:                       Sz = size(Bin0),
 2611:                       <<243:8,0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5,19:8>> = id(Bin1),
 2612:                       Bin
 2613:               end,
 2614:     transform_bins(MakeSub, Term).
 2615: 
 2616: id(I) -> I.
 2617: 
 2618: %% Convert all binaries in a term to refc binaries.
 2619: 
 2620: make_refc_binaries(Term) ->
 2621:     F = fun(B0) -> list_to_binary([build_binary(?heap_binary_size+1),B0]) end,
 2622:     transform_bins(F, Term).
 2623: 
 2624: build_binary(Elements) ->
 2625:     rand:bytes(Elements).
 2626: 
 2627: build_list(Elements) -> build_list(Elements, []).
 2628: 
 2629: build_list(0, Acc) -> Acc;
 2630: build_list(Elements, Acc) -> build_list(Elements-1, [random_char()|Acc]).
 2631: 
 2632: 
 2633: %% Convert all binaries in a list to writable binaries.
 2634: 
 2635: make_writable_binaries(Term) ->
 2636:     transform_bins(fun(Bin) -> <<Bin/binary,1,2,3>> end, Term).
 2637: 
 2638: append_to_writable_binaries(Term) ->
 2639:     transform_bins(fun(Bin) -> <<Bin/binary,0:(64*1024*8)>> end, Term).
 2640: 
 2641: random_char() ->
 2642:     uniform(256) - 1.
 2643: 
 2644: uniform(N) ->
 2645:     rand:uniform(N).
 2646: 
 2647: erl_millisecs() ->
 2648:     erl_millisecs(erlang:monotonic_time()).
 2649: 
 2650: erl_millisecs(MonotonicTime) ->
 2651:     (1000*MonotonicTime)/erlang:convert_time_unit(1,second,native).
 2652: 
 2653: %% Start/stop drivers.
 2654: start_driver(Config, Name, Binary) ->
 2655:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2656:     erl_ddll:start(),
 2657: 
 2658:     %% Load the driver
 2659:     ok = load_driver(Path, Name),
 2660: 
 2661:     %% open port.
 2662:     case Binary of
 2663:         true ->
 2664:             open_port({spawn, Name}, [binary]);
 2665:         false ->
 2666:             open_port({spawn, Name}, [])
 2667:     end.
 2668: 
 2669: stop_driver(Port, Name) ->
 2670:     true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 2671:     receive
 2672:         {Port,Message} ->
 2673:             ct:fail({strange_message_from_port,Message})
 2674:     after 0 ->
 2675:               ok
 2676:     end,
 2677: 
 2678:     %% Unload the driver.
 2679:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Name),
 2680:     ok = erl_ddll:stop().
 2681: 
 2682: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2683:     Before = erlang:system_info(taints),
 2684:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2685:         ok ->
 2686:             After = erlang:system_info(taints),
 2687:             case lists:member(Driver, Before) of
 2688:                 true ->
 2689:                     After = Before;
 2690:                 false ->
 2691:                     true = lists:member(Driver, After),
 2692:                     Before = lists:delete(Driver, After)
 2693:             end,
 2694:             ok;
 2695:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2696:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2697:             Res
 2698:     end.
 2699: 
 2700: sleep() ->
 2701:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
 2702: 
 2703: sleep(infinity) ->
 2704:     sleep();
 2705: sleep(Ms) when is_integer(Ms), Ms >= 0 ->
 2706:     receive after Ms -> ok end.
 2707: 
 2708: 
 2709: setup_logger(Node) ->
 2710:     {ok, Pwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 2711:     Name = hd(string:lexemes(atom_to_list(Node), "@")),
 2712:     LogPath = filename:join(Pwd, "error_log." ++ Name),
 2713:     ct:pal("Logging to: ~s", [LogPath]),
 2714:     rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handler, [file_handler, logger_std_h,
 2715:                                          #{formatter => {logger_formatter,#{ single_line => false }},
 2716:                                            config => #{file => LogPath }}]).
 2717: 
 2718: wait_deallocations() ->
 2719:     try
 2720:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations)
 2721:     catch error:undef ->
 2722:               erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 2723:               wait_deallocations()
 2724:     end.
 2725: 
 2726: driver_alloc_size() ->
 2727:     wait_deallocations(),
 2728:     erts_debug:alloc_blocks_size(driver_alloc).
 2729: 
 2730: rpc(Config, Fun) ->
 2731:     case proplists:get_value(node, Config) of
 2732:         undefined ->
 2733:             Fun();
 2734:         {_Peer, Node} ->
 2735:             ct:log("Running RPC ~p on ~p/~p~n", [Fun, _Peer, Node]),
 2736:             Self = self(),
 2737:             Ref = make_ref(),
 2738:             Pid = spawn(Node,
 2739:                         fun() ->
 2740:                                 Result
 2741:                                     = try Fun() of
 2742:                                           Res -> Res
 2743:                                       catch E:R:Stk ->
 2744:                                               {'EXIT',E,R,Stk}
 2745:                                       end,
 2746:                                 Self ! {Ref, Result}
 2747:                         end),
 2748:             MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
 2749:             receive
 2750:                 {'DOWN', MRef, _Type, _Object, Info} ->
 2751:                     erlang:error({died, Pid, Info});
 2752:                 {Ref, {'EXIT',E,R,ST}} ->
 2753:                     erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 2754:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST);
 2755:                 {Ref, Ret} ->
 2756:                     erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 2757:                     Ret;
 2758:                 Other ->
 2759:                     ct:fail(Other)
 2760:             end
 2761:     end.
 2762: 
 2763: poll_pipe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2764:     %% ERL-647; we wouldn't see any events on EOF when polling a pipe using
 2765:     %% kqueue(2).
 2766:     case os:type() of
 2767:         {unix, _} ->
 2768:             Command = "erl -noshell -eval "
 2769:                       "'\"DATA\n\" = io:get_line(\"\"),"
 2770:                       "eof = io:get_line(\"\"),"
 2771:                       "halt()' <<< 'DATA'",
 2772:             Ref = make_ref(),
 2773:             Self = self(),
 2774:             Pid = spawn(fun() -> os:cmd(Command), Self ! Ref end),
 2775:             receive
 2776:                 Ref -> ok
 2777:             after 5000 ->
 2778:                 exit(Pid, kill),
 2779:                 ct:fail("Stuck reading from stdin.")
 2780:             end;
 2781:         _ ->
 2782:             {skipped, "Unix-only test"}
 2783:     end.
